class.name: B4R::B4RLiquidCrystal_I2C
class.comment: rLiquidCrystal_I2CEX.h Library for the I2C LCD Displays 20x4 (20 columns, 4 rows) or 16x2 (16 columns, 2 rows). The LCD display is connected to the I2C pins SDA, SCL of the Arduino. The LCD display default addresses (Byte) are LCD20x4: 0x27, LCD16x2: 0x3F Additional Libraries required: None Additional Classes required (included in the wrapped library folder): None Notes: First library wrapping done by Anywhere Software (www.b4x.com) > Many thanks.

property.name: Blink
property.comment: Set cursor blink ON (true) or OFF (false).

property.name: CursorOn
property.comment: Sets the cursor state ON (true) or OFF ( false)

property.name: Backlight
property.comment: Turn the LCD backlight ON (true) or OFF (false)

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Init the LCD with address (default 0x27) and columns (20), rows (4)

method.name: SetCursor
method.comment: Set the cursor position at column, row LCD20x4: Columns = 0-19, Rows = 0-3 LCD16x2: Columns = 0-15, Rows = 0-1

method.name: Write
method.comment: Write text at the position prior set via SetCursor(Col,Row). The text can be a string, number or array of bytes.

method.name: WriteAt
method.comment: Write text at the position col,row. The text can be a string, number or array of bytes. Column: 0-19 (LCD20x4), 0-15 (LCD16x2) Row: 0-3 (LCD20x4), 0-1 (LCD16x2)

method.name: Clear
method.comment: Clear the screen and set the cursor at position 0,0.

method.name: ClearRow
method.comment: Clear a row and set the cursor at position 0, row.

method.name: CreateChar
method.comment: Create special character location 0-7. The Charmap as byte array contains the 8 bytes of the character.

method.name: WriteCharAt
method.comment: Write special character wih location 0-7 at the position column, row. Note: The first column or row start with 0. The special character has to be created first with function CreateChar. LCD20x4: Columns = 0-19, Rows = 0-3 LCD16x2: Columns = 0-15, Rows = 0-1
